Replay API REPL-64

EPIC/PROJECT: Custom Codec/VideoConverter - "The Ultimate CS Demo Viewer"

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 28/mai/24 1:22 PM   28/mai/24 1:22 PM           0 1   *Overview*

LeetGaming’s Demo Viewer will revolutionize how CS:2 demos are consumed and analyzed, providing a stunning spectator experience alongside in-depth analytics generated from the ReplayAPI. It will cater to casual viewers, esports fans, analysts, and developers alike.

*Key Objectives*

# *Demo to Video Conversion (Backend):*
#* Robust Conversion Engine: Develop a reliable back-end service to convert .dem files into high-quality video formats (e.g., MP4, WebM).
#** *Solution:* Investigate open-source libraries like "DemoInfo" (C#) or "node-csgo-parser" (JavaScript) to extract demo data.
#** {{Workaround: If direct conversion is challenging, explore screen recording of the demo playback in a CS client with custom overlays.}}
#* Optimized Encoding: Ensure efficient video encoding for smooth playback and reduced bandwidth usage.
# *Analytics Overlay Generation (Backend):*
#* ReplayAPI Integration: Seamlessly integrate with the LeetGaming ReplayAPI to extract granular game data (economy, strategies, player stats, etc.).
#* Dynamic Overlay Creation: Generate visually appealing overlays that dynamically display relevant analytics synchronized with the video timeline.
#* Customization Options: Allow users to tailor the type and appearance of overlays based on preferences.
# *CDN Deployment and Link Generation (Backend):*
#* CDN Integration: Utilize a content delivery network (e.g., Cloudflare, AWS CloudFront) for fast and reliable video delivery.
#* Secure Link Generation: Create secure, shareable links to video replays with customizable permissions (e.g.,public, private, time-limited).
# *Custom Video Player (Frontend):*
#* Intuitive Interface: Design a clean, user-friendly player interface focused on the demo viewing experience.
#* Interactive Timeline: Implement a slider with round/match/highlight markers for easy navigation.
#* Overlay Control: Provide options to toggle overlays on/off, adjust their opacity, and customize their appearance.
#* Fullscreen Support: Enable immersive viewing with fullscreen mode.
# *Bug Report Workflow (Frontend & Backend):*
#* Developer-Specific Sharing: Allow users to share demo links with specific timestamps highlighting a bug or issue.
#* Focused View: Automatically navigate to the specified timestamp and display relevant analytics for in-depth analysis.
#* Bug Reporting Integration: Potentially integrate with issue-tracking platforms (e.g., GitHub, Jira) to streamline bug reporting from within the player.

*Implementation Phases*

# *Phase 1: Core Video Conversion and Player:* Build the back-end conversion service and a basic front-end player with timeline navigation.
# *Phase 2: Analytics Overlays:* Integrate the ReplayAPI and implement dynamic overlay generation.
# *Phase 3: CDN Deployment and Sharing:* Set up CDN integration and secure link generation.
# *Phase 4: Bug Report Workflow:* Implement developer-specific sharing and focused view features.
# *Phase 5: Frontend Refinement and Feature Expansion:* Iterate on the player interface, add customization options, and explore additional features based on user feedback (e.g., real-time chat, interactive stats comparison).

*KPIs*

* Number of active users
* Volume of uploaded and shared demo videos
* Average watch time per video
* User satisfaction ratings
* Conversion rate for developer-specific sharing and bug reporting

*Additional Considerations*

* *Monetization:* Explore potential monetization strategies (e.g., premium features, subscriptions, advertisements).
* *Community Building:* Foster a community around ReplayAPI through forums, social media, and content creation incentives.
* *Esports Integration:* Partner with esports organizations to showcase professional matches and analysis using ReplayAPI. 		28/mai/24 1:22 PM Em andamento orange
0|i000e7: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-63

EPIC: Replay Vault - CS Demo Cloud Drive/Browser (User Replay Demo File Storage/Manager)

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 28/mai/24 1:00 PM   28/mai/24 1:43 PM           0 1   *Overview*

The LeetGaming Replay Vault will revolutionize how users store, manage, share, and analyze their game replays. It will cater to both casual gamers and esports professionals, offering a secure, feature-rich platform that goes beyond simple file uploading.

*Key Objectives*

# *Secure and Scalable Storage:* Leverage a robust cloud-based storage solution (e.g., AWS S3 or Google Cloud Storage) to ensure the safety, integrity, and accessibility of user-uploaded replay files.
# *ResourceOwner Integration:* Seamlessly integrate with the LeetGaming ReplayAPI's ResourceOwner framework to enforce ownership, permissions, and access control over replay files.
# *Advanced Sharing and Privacy Controls:*
#* Customizable Sharing: Allow users to generate shareable links with granular permissions (view-only,comment, etc.).
#* Link Expiration and Revocation: Provide options to set expiration dates for shared links and revoke access at any time.
#* Custom Sharing Rules: Enable users to create rules for who can view or interact with their shared replays.
#* Developer-Specific Sharing: Implement a mechanism to share specific moments, highlights, or events from a replay file, ideal for analysis and collaboration on platforms like GitHub.
# *File Organization and Management:*
#* Folder Structure: Allow users to organize their replays into folders and subfolders.
#* Shared Folders: Enable collaborative folder sharing among friends or teams.
#* File Metadata and Tagging: Implement metadata tagging for easier search and filtering.
# *Rich Social Features:*
#* Comments and Discussion Threads: Foster community interaction around replay files.
#* Likes and Dislikes: Add social feedback mechanisms.
#* Ratings (1-5 stars): Enable quality ratings for replays.
#* View Counter (Optional): Allow users to track the popularity of their replays.
# *Demo-Specific Features:*
#* Highlight Generation: Automatically identify and extract key highlights from demo files.
#* Event Timestamping: Mark specific events (e.g., kills, objectives) within the replay for quick navigation.
#* In-Game Overlays: Integrate with game clients to display relevant replay information during playback.

*Technical Considerations*

* *Backend API (Core Focus):*
** RESTful API Design: Use industry-standard practices for consistency and ease of integration.
** Authentication and Authorization: Implement robust security measures using tokens, OAuth, or similar mechanisms.
** Replay File Processing: Develop backend services to handle file uploads, storage, transcoding (if necessary),and metadata extraction.
** Sharing Logic: Design algorithms to generate unique shareable links, enforce custom sharing rules, and track usage.
** Event Tracking: Implement analytics to monitor replay views, interactions, and sharing patterns.
* *Frontend Development (Optional):*
** User-Friendly Interface: Create a visually appealing and intuitive web or mobile app for managing replays.
** Replay Player: Consider integrating or developing a custom replay player for in-browser or in-app viewing.
** Social Features: Implement UI elements for commenting, liking, rating, and sharing.

*Implementation Phases*

# *Phase 1: Core Storage and Sharing:* Build the backend API infrastructure for secure storage, resource ownership,and basic sharing functionality.
# *Phase 2: Advanced Sharing and Social Features:* Add customizable sharing rules, developer-specific sharing,and social interaction features.
# *Phase 3: Demo-Specific Enhancements:* Implement highlight generation, event timestamping, and in-game overlay integration.
# *Phase 4: Frontend Development and Refinement:* Build a user-friendly interface and iterate on features based on user feedback.

*Key Metrics for Success*

* Number of active users
* Volume of uploaded and shared replays
* Average engagement time per replay
* Conversion rate for developer-specific sharing
* User satisfaction ratings 		28/mai/24 1:00 PM Em andamento purple
0|i000dz: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-62

EPIC: Ingest Stats into ML Model (AI)

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 26/mai/24 2:25 PM   26/mai/24 2:25 PM           0 1   Jira Ticket

*Project:* LeetGaming Backend

*Issue Type:* Task

*Summary:* Develop and Train Machine Learning Model for Pro Player Talent Identification

*Description:*

This task involves developing and training a machine learning (ML) model to predict the potential of CS2 players to become professionals. The model will take two primary inputs:

# *Massive Serial Events:* A comprehensive stream of in-game events (kills, assists, bomb events, etc.) from a player's match history.
# *Massive Stats Object:* Aggregated statistics and highlights generated from the state machine analysis, including economic data, clutch performance, and specific pro player signals.

The model should be able to analyze these large datasets and output a prediction score indicating the player's likelihood of transitioning to professional play.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* *Model Selection:* Choose an appropriate ML model architecture (e.g., deep neural network, gradient boosting, ensemble model) based on the available data and desired prediction accuracy.
* *Feature Engineering:* Extract meaningful features from the input data to train the model effectively.
* *Model Training:* Train the model on a large dataset of labeled player data (professional vs. non-professional).
* *Model Evaluation:* Evaluate the model's performance using appropriate metrics (e.g., accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score) and validation techniques (e.g., cross-validation).
* *Deployment:* Deploy the trained model to a production environment for inference.
* *API Integration:* Integrate the model's predictions into the existing LeetGaming backend API to provide talent scores to client applications.

*Technical Requirements:*

# *Data Preparation:*
#* Acquire a large dataset of CS2 match data with corresponding player labels (professional/non-professional). This could be obtained through partnerships with data providers, scraping public data sources, or manual labeling.
#* Clean and preprocess the raw match data to ensure it is suitable for model training (e.g., handle missing values, normalize features).
#* Split the dataset into training, validation, and test sets to evaluate the model's performance.
# *Feature Engineering:*
#* Extract relevant features from the serial events and stats object, such as:
#** *Individual Player Stats:* K/D ratio, ADR, KAST, impact rating, headshot percentage, etc.
#** *Pro Player Signals:* Scores for the various signals defined in the previous Jira ticket.
#** *Economic Performance:* Total spend, utility usage, weapon choices, win rate in different economic situations.
#** *Clutch Performance:* Clutch win rate, clutch type distribution, etc.
#** *Teamplay:* Assists, flash assists, trade kills, etc.
# *Model Selection and Training:*
#* Explore different ML model architectures (neural networks, decision trees, etc.) to find the best fit for the data and task.
#* Train the model on the training set using appropriate optimization algorithms and hyperparameter tuning.
#* Validate the model on the validation set and adjust the hyperparameters as needed.
# *Model Evaluation:*
#* Evaluate the final model on the test set to assess its generalization performance.
#* Choose appropriate evaluation metrics based on the project goals (e.g., if false positives are more costly than false negatives, focus on precision).
# *Deployment and API Integration:*
#* Deploy the trained model to a scalable and reliable environment (e.g., cloud-based ML platform, containerized service).
#* Create an API endpoint to accept match data and return the model's talent prediction score for each player.
#* Consider versioning the model to allow for updates and improvements over time.

*Available/Indicated Providers:*

* *Cloud ML Platforms:*
** Google Cloud AI Platform
** Amazon SageMaker
** Microsoft Azure Machine Learning
* *ML Frameworks:*
** TensorFlow
** PyTorch
** scikit-learn

*Output/Schema:*

* The model should output a numerical score for each player in a match, representing their predicted pro player potential.
* The API response could include the following schema:

{noformat}JSON{noformat}

{noformat}{
"matchId": "uuid",
"playerScores": [
{
"playerId": "int",
"talentScore": "float"
},
{
"playerId": 1234,
"predictionAccuracy": 0.66,
"proPotential": {
"overallScore": 0.85, // Overall pro potential score (0.0 - 1.0)
"categoryScores": {
"gameSense": 0.92,
"mechanicalSkill": 0.88,
"teamwork": 0.75,
"consistency": 0.80
}
},
"strengths": [
"Excellent clutch performance under pressure",
"High accuracy with rifles and AWP",
"Strong map awareness and positioning",
"Effective use of utility grenades",
"Consistently high impact in most rounds"
],
"weaknesses": [
"Tendency to overextend in certain situations",
"Needs improvement in pistol round performance",
"Could communicate more proactively with teammates"
],
"recommendations": [
"Focus on improving pistol round aim and decision-making",
"Practice more varied utility lineups and timings",
"Work on communicating enemy positions and intentions more consistently"
]
}

{noformat} 		CS:GO/CS:2, ML, Prediction, Talent 26/mai/24 2:25 PM Em andamento dark_yellow
0|i000dr: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-61

[PARSER] Pro Signals - Stats

Tarefa Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 26/mai/24 1:47 PM   26/mai/24 1:47 PM           0 1   DRAFT:

||Signal Type||Description||Scoring Factors||Example Score (Base)||
|Opening Kill|First kill of the round|Difficulty, impact on round momentum, weapon used|10-15 points|
|Clutch Kill|Kill in a 1vX situation to win the round|Clutch type (1v1, 1v2, etc.), remaining time, economic situation, weapon used|15-30 points|
|Flash Assist|Flashbang that directly leads to a teammate's kill|Timing, positioning, impact of the resulting kill|8-12 points|
|Smoke Assist|Smoke grenade that creates cover for a teammate's actions (e.g., plant, defuse, retake)|Timing, positioning, impact on the round outcome|6-10 points|
|Molotov/HE Grenade Damage|Inflicting significant damage with a Molotov or HE grenade|Damage dealt, number of enemies affected, round impact|5-8 points|
|Eco Round Win|Winning a round with significantly less equipment than the opponents|Economic disparity, round impact|10-15 points|
|Ninja Defuse|Defusing the bomb without being detected|Stealth, risk, impact on round outcome|15-20 points|
|Ace|Killing all 5 opponents in a round|Difficulty, round impact|25-30 points|
|Wallbang Kill|Killing an opponent through a wall using precise knowledge of map geometry|Difficulty, unexpectedness, weapon used|12-18 points|
|Flank|Successfully attacking the enemy from an unexpected angle|Timing, positioning, impact on round outcome|10-15 points|
|Retake|Regaining control of a bombsite after the enemy has planted|Coordination, timing, impact on round outcome|15-20 points|
|Economic Shutdown|Winning a round and leaving the opponents with a severely weakened economy|Economic impact on subsequent rounds|8-12 points|
|1v1 Win|Winning a 1v1 duel|Weapon used, remaining health, clutch situation|10-15 points|
|Multi-Kill|Killing multiple opponents in quick succession|Number of kills (2, 3, 4, or 5), difficulty, impact on round|12-20 points|
|Opening Pick|Getting the first kill with the AWP|Difficulty, impact on round momentum|12-15 points|
|Thrifty Round Win|Winning a round with minimal spending on equipment|Economic efficiency, round impact|8-12 points|
|Aggressive Push|Successfully executing a fast-paced, aggressive attack on a bombsite|Timing, coordination, impact on round outcome|10-15 points|
|Tactical Retreat|Making a calculated decision to retreat to avoid a disadvantageous fight|Decision-making, game sense, impact on avoiding losses|5-8 points|

Pprioritize: Pro Player Signals that are more indicative of potential professional talent:

||Signal Type||Description||Scoring Factors||Example Score (Base)||
|Opening Kill|First kill of the round|Weapon used (rifle vs. pistol), difficulty of the duel, impact on early round momentum, distance of kill|15-25 points|
|Clutch Kill|Kill in a 1vX situation to win the round|Clutch type (1v1, 1v2, etc.), remaining time, economic situation, weapon used, number of kills in the clutch|20-40 points|
|High-Impact Utility|Utility (flash, smoke, molotov) that directly creates a significant advantage for the team|Timing, creativity, impact on round outcome (e.g., successful site take/retake, multiple kills)|10-20 points|
|Eco Round Win|Winning a round with significantly less equipment than the opponents|Economic disparity, number of kills secured in the round, round impact|15-25 points|
|Ninja Defuse|Defusing the bomb without being detected|Stealth, risk, impact on round outcome, remaining time|20-30 points|
|Ace|Killing all 5 opponents in a round|Weapon variety, difficulty, round impact|30-50 points|
|Consecutive Entry Frags|Getting multiple opening kills in consecutive rounds|Consistency, aggression, impact on team momentum|15-25 points|
|High-Value Target Elimination|Eliminating a key opponent player (e.g., the AWPer, entry fragger)|Importance of the eliminated player to the enemy team, round impact|12-18 points|
|Efficient Economy Management|Consistently making cost-effective purchases that maximize impact for the available money|Round outcomes, kill-to-death ratio (K/D) in relation to equipment value, ability to adapt to changing economic situations|5-10 points per round|
|Adaptive Playstyle|Demonstrating flexibility in playstyle based on the map, team composition, and game situation|Variety of weapons used effectively, successful role switching (e.g., entry fragger to support), ability to counter-strat the enemy team|10-15 points|
|Effective Communication|Providing clear and timely communication that benefits the team|Information shared (callouts, enemy positions, strategy suggestions), impact on team decision-making and round outcome|5-10 points per round|

* *Focus on Skill and Impact:* The scoring should emphasizes actions that demonstrate exceptional skill, game sense and a direct impact on the round or match outcome.
* *Pro-Level Play Indicators:* Signals like "Consecutive Entry Frags," "High-Value Target Elimination," and "Adaptive Playstyle" are specifically aimed at identifying players who exhibit pro-level decision-making and mechanical skill.
* *Economy Management:* Added a metric to reward players who consistently make smart economic choices that contribute to the team's success.
* *Communication:* Effective communication is crucial in professional play, so this signal highlights players who excel in this area.

*Additional Considerations:*

* The "Example Score (Base)" values are still estimates. The actual scoring algorithm would need to be fine-tuned based on extensive data analysis and expert input (TODO: task for expert input).***
* Consider adding more signals specific to certain roles (e.g., support players might get points for well-placed utility, AWPers for opening picks).
* Weigh different signals differently based on their overall importance in identifying pro potential. For example, clutch kills might carry more weight than opening kills. 		26/mai/24 1:47 PM Em andamento
0|i000dj: Nenhum

Replay API REPL-45

[PARSER] Stats - Clutch Situation

Tarefa Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) psavelis Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 26/mai/24 10:16 AM 29/out/24 11:05 AM 12/jul/24 5:50 PM           0 1   26/mai/24 10:16 AM Em andamento EPIC: Replay API Core Development

Replay API REPL-43

[Search] Pro-Level Insights: Evolve LeetGaming Game Event Search

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) psavelis Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 25/mai/24 1:53 PM   25/mai/24 1:53 PM           0 1   *Description:*

This epic aims to transform game event search into a strategic asset, offering deep insights into gameplay patterns, trends, and opponent analysis. We'll achieve this by augmenting our existing MongoDB infrastructure with Elasticsearch, unlocking real-time analytics, advanced filtering, and AI-driven insights.

*Technical Goals/Objectives:*

# *Elasticsearch Augmentation:*
#* *Data Enrichment:* Enhance raw event data with calculated metrics (e.g., kill/death ratios, objective capture times) and metadata (player rankings, team compositions) before indexing into Elasticsearch.
#* *Real-Time Indexing:* Leverage MongoDB change streams to synchronize event data with Elasticsearch in near real-time.
#* *Index Optimization:* Design Elasticsearch mappings to optimize for speed and relevance in the context of competitive gaming search.
#* *Query Language Expansion:* Introduce Elasticsearch's Query DSL for complex filtering, aggregations, and ranking tailored to competitive analysis.
# *Advanced Search Features:*
#* *Timeline Visualization:* Enable users to explore events on an interactive timeline, highlighting key moments within matches.
#* *Pattern Recognition:* Use machine learning algorithms to identify recurring gameplay patterns (e.g.,common strategies, map hotspots) and surface them in search results.
#* *Comparative Analysis:* Allow users to compare event statistics across different players, teams, or matches.
#* *Customizable Dashboards:* Let users create personalized dashboards to track their own performance or monitor specific aspects of gameplay.
# *Integration with Existing Systems:*
#* *Seamless MongoDB Integration:* Maintain MongoDB as the primary data store while leveraging Elasticsearch for search and analytics.
#* *API Enhancement:* Extend the existing LeetGaming API to expose the new search capabilities to clients.

*Technical Acceptance Criteria:*

* Elasticsearch cluster integrated with MongoDB and fully populated with enriched game event data.
* New search API endpoints are implemented and documented.
* Frontend search UI is updated to leverage the new features.
* Comprehensive unit and integration tests ensure data integrity and search accuracy.
* Performance benchmarks demonstrate significant improvements in search speed and relevance compared to the existing system.

*Implementation Plan:*

# *Elasticsearch Infrastructure:* Set up and configure a dedicated Elasticsearch cluster optimized for search and analytics workloads.
# *Data Enrichment Pipeline:* Develop a data pipeline (e.g., using Kafka or custom scripts) to enrich raw event data and stream it into Elasticsearch.
# *Search API Development:*
#* Design API endpoints for complex search queries, aggregations, and timeline visualizations.
#* Implement authentication and authorization to protect sensitive data.
# *Frontend Integration:*
#* Update search UI components to interact with the new API.
#* Develop visualizations for timelines, patterns, and comparative analysis.
#* Allow users to create and customize dashboards.
# *Testing & Optimization:*
#* Conduct rigorous testing to ensure data accuracy, search functionality, and performance.
#* Optimize Elasticsearch queries and index settings for maximum efficiency.

*Dependencies:*

* MongoDB
* Elasticsearch
* Kafka (or equivalent message queue for real-time data streaming)
* Relevant Go libraries for Elasticsearch and MongoDB interaction

*Out of Scope (for now):*

* Real-time event streaming to clients (potential future enhancement).

*Metrics:*

* *Search Latency:* Time to return search results (target sub-second response times).
* *Query Complexity:* Track the complexity of user queries to identify optimization opportunities.
* *User Engagement:* Measure the impact of new features on user engagement and retention.

*Risks/Cons:*

* + index management. 		Analytics, Elastic, Filter, GameEvent, Optimization, Search, Streams 25/mai/24 1:53 PM Em andamento dark_teal
0|i0009b: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-42

[API][Backend] Generic MongoDB Repository with Pagination and Filtering

Tarefa Concluído Medium Itens concluídos psavelis Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 5:09 PM   05/ago/24 11:11 PM 05/ago/24 11:11 PM         0 1   *Description:*

Develop a generic MongoDB repository abstraction layer within the replay-api to streamline data access and management for various entities. This repository will support essential features like pagination, filtering, sorting, and CRUD operations, making it reusable across different client applications and the CLI/SDK.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* *Generic Repository Interface:* Define a generic interface for the MongoDB repository, outlining common operations like {{GetById}}, {{Find}}, {{Create}}, {{Update}}, {{Delete}}, etc.
* *Pagination:* Implement pagination functionality to efficiently retrieve and display large datasets in smaller chunks.
* *Filtering:* Allow filtering of data based on various criteria using flexible query parameters.
* *Sorting:* Enable sorting of results based on specified fields and directions.
* *CRUD Operations:* Support basic create, read, update, and delete operations for different entities.
* *Error Handling:* Implement comprehensive error handling to gracefully manage database errors and provide informative feedback to clients.
* *Testing:* Develop unit and integration tests to ensure the correctness and reliability of the repository.
* *Documentation:* Provide clear and concise documentation for the repository usage in the API, CLI, and SDK.

*Technical Requirements:*

# *MongoDB Driver:* Utilize the official Go MongoDB driver to interact with the database.
# *Generics (Go 1.22):* Leverage Go generics to create a type-safe and reusable repository implementation.
# *Data Models:* Define appropriate data models (structs) for the entities that will be managed by the repository.
# *Query Building:* Implement a mechanism to build dynamic MongoDB queries based on provided filters, sorting options, and pagination parameters.
# *Dependency Injection:* Integrate the repository with the existing replay-api framework using dependency injection for easier testing and maintainability.

*Implementation Notes:*

* The repository should be designed to be easily extended to support new entities and custom query requirements.
* Consider using helper functions or libraries to simplify common tasks like query building and pagination.
* Optimize database queries for performance, especially when dealing with large datasets.

*Additional Considerations:*

* Explore advanced features like aggregation pipelines for more complex data processing.
* Investigate caching mechanisms to improve response times for frequently accessed data.
* Consider integrating with the Resource Owner framework for fine-grained access control to data.

*DRAFT (**Without HTTP Layer details**)*
!https://mermaid.ink/img/pako:eNqVUkFuwjAQ_MrKJyrBB3KoBIQEpHKhqJeYwzbZJivideTYrSji73WTqhd6SH3y7MzseG1fVWkrUomqHXYNHFMtWvrwOsInIp-jYakhc1Y8SaUF4loWKXqEF-4DtvyJnq3A2prOCok_wWLxCKvZGl0VNfTxMN21nh3ZUMtC_3Wms9zxb95w1L9HWWF5jjQ46lq8LLDjMWRT7NGXDQxRBxs8nUYiK6KTYPMes-7ZvIgotrsjtsVhSICMW7qnd0VOQo5L2FupbbqCKLc9e-su40SbqcJsqjCfKtz-3uBywDstaq4MOYNcxe9y_W6klW_IkFZJ3FbozlppuUUdBm-fL1KqxLtAc-VsqBuVvGHbRxS6Cj2ljPFlzE_19gWl6tjH?type=png|width=1396,height=318!

Replay API REPL-41

[API][Backend] Routes for Data Visualization Component

Tarefa Em andamento Medium Não resolvido(s) Babu Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 4:59 PM 29/out/24 11:09 AM 12/out/24 8:22 PM           0 1   *Description:*

Develop the necessary backend routes to support the data fetching and pagination requirements of the new data visualization component in the LeetGaming frontend. These routes will utilize the existing Resource Owner framework within the replay-api to ensure secure and efficient data access.

*Acceptance Criteria (DRAFT) :*

* *Match Data Route:* Implement a route (e.g., {{/matches}}) to retrieve match data, including details like map, statistics, and round information. The route should support pagination to handle large datasets.
* *Game Event Data Route:* Implement a route (e.g., {{/matches/:matchId/events}}) to fetch game events associated with a specific match. The route should support filtering and pagination.
* *Round Data Route:* Implement a route (e.g., {{/matches/:matchId/rounds}}) to retrieve round-specific data, such as winners, scores, and events. The route should support pagination.
* *Replay File Data Route:* Implement a route (e.g., {{/matches/:matchId/replays}}) to fetch information about available replay files for a match. The route should include details like file names, durations, and relevant metadata.





*Technical Requirements:*

# *Resource Owner Framework:* Utilize the existing Resource Owner framework in the replay-api to handle authentication and authorization for data access.
# *Data Retrieval:* Implement logic to fetch the required data from the appropriate data sources (e.g., databases, file storage).
# *Pagination:* Apply pagination techniques to limit the amount of data returned in each response and provide efficient data retrieval for large datasets.
# *Filtering (Optional):* Implement filtering capabilities for the game event data route to allow users to filter events based on specific criteria (e.g., event type, round number).
# *Error Handling:* Implement robust error handling to provide informative error messages to the frontend in case of failures or invalid requests.

*Implementation Notes:*

* Leverage existing data models and query optimization techniques to ensure efficient data retrieval.
* Coordinate with the frontend team to define the expected response format and data structure for each route.
* Thoroughly test the routes with various scenarios, including different data sizes and edge cases.

*Dependencies:*

* The Resource Owner framework in the replay-api must be fully functional.
* The required data sources (e.g., databases, file storage) must be accessible and contain the necessary data.

*Assigned To:* (Assign to relevant backend developer)

*Priority:* High

*Due Date:* (Set a realistic deadline based on project timelines)

*Labels:* , , Visualization,  		API, Data, Filter, Next.js, NextUI, ReplayAPI, ResourceOwner 23/mai/24 4:59 PM Em andamento EPIC: Replay API Core Development

Replay API REPL-38

[Testing][Load] Containerized Automated Load Testing

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 4:31 PM   23/mai/24 4:31 PM           0 1   *Description:*

Establish a robust, automated load testing framework utilizing containerization to ensure consistent and reproducible testing across environments. The framework will proactively assess application performance, scalability, and stability under varying load conditions, identifying bottlenecks and ensuring optimal user experience.

*Key Objectives:*

# *Load Test Script Development:* Design and develop realistic load test scripts using tools like JMeter or k6,simulating diverse user behavior and traffic patterns. Scripts should include parameterized values for flexible configuration.
# *Dockerized Test Environment:* Create Docker images for the load testing tool (JMeter/k6), dependencies (e.g.,Java runtime), and the application under test (AUT). Utilize Docker Compose to orchestrate a multi-container environment for seamless execution.
# *CI/CD Pipeline Integration:* Integrate load tests into the CI/CD pipeline (Jenkins/GitLab CI) to run on triggers like code commits, merges, or scheduled intervals. Utilize pipeline variables to control test duration, concurrency,and other parameters.
# *Real-Time Monitoring and Reporting:* Implement a monitoring stack (Prometheus, InfluxDB) to collect metrics from the load test and the AUT. Visualize these metrics in real-time dashboards (Grafana) and generate comprehensive reports for post-test analysis.
# *Alerting and Anomaly Detection:* Configure alerts based on predefined thresholds (e.g., response time, error rate) using tools like Alertmanager. Investigate anomaly detection techniques to identify unexpected behavior during tests.

*Technical Approach:*

# *Load Testing Tool Selection:*
#* *JMeter:* Suitable for complex scenarios, supports multiple protocols, extensive plugin ecosystem.
#* *k6:* Modern, developer-friendly, scripting in JavaScript, excellent for high-load testing.
# *Containerization (Docker):*
#* Create Dockerfiles for each component: load testing tool, dependencies, AUT.
#* Utilize Docker Compose to define and manage multi-container setup.
#* Publish necessary ports for communication between containers.
# *CI/CD Pipeline (Jenkins/GitLab CI):*
#* Define stages for: building Docker images, deploying containers, executing load tests, collecting results.
#* Use environment variables to control test parameters dynamically.
#* Integrate with artifact repositories (Docker Hub, etc.) for image storage.
# *Monitoring and Reporting (Prometheus/Grafana):*
#* Expose metrics from the load test and AUT using appropriate exporters (e.g., JMeter Prometheus Listener).
#* Configure Prometheus to scrape metrics from exporters.
#* Create Grafana dashboards to visualize key performance metrics.
# *Alerting (Alertmanager):*
#* Define alerting rules based on thresholds for response time, error rate, etc.
#* Integrate with communication channels (email, Slack) to send notifications.

*Tasks/User Stories (Detailed Breakdown):*

# *Load Test Tool Setup:* Install chosen tool (JMeter/k6) and any required plugins.
# *Scenario Design:* Define a comprehensive set of load test scenarios covering various user journeys and expected traffic patterns.
# *Script Development:* Write load test scripts following best practices for modularity, parameterization, and error handling.
# *Docker Image Creation:*
#* Create Dockerfile for JMeter/k6 with necessary dependencies and configurations.
#* Create Dockerfile for the AUT to run in a container.
#* Create Docker Compose file to orchestrate multi-container environment.
# *CI/CD Pipeline Configuration:*
#* Set up pipeline stages and define triggers for load test execution.
#* Configure build steps to create Docker images and push to the repository.
#* Add steps to deploy containers using Docker Compose.
#* Integrate script execution into the pipeline, passing parameters via environment variables.
# *Monitoring Setup:*
#* Install and configure Prometheus to scrape metrics from load test and AUT exporters.
#* Install and configure Grafana to visualize metrics.
#* Create dashboards for real-time monitoring and historical analysis.
# *Alerting Configuration:*
#* Install and configure Alertmanager to receive alerts from Prometheus.
#* Define alerting rules with appropriate thresholds and notification channels.


*DRAFT Solution*

!https://mermaid.ink/img/pako:eNqVU11r2zAU_StChdFBspYGxuKHQpaU0rFCydKnag-qdR2LyJKRrrZ6pf99V_6IUzJo5xdfSefo3HMkPfPcKeAZ33pZl-z7WtgQH_uBk4ptICC7sr-0d7YCi8Iy-r7dAoI_231-EHyEbZwz7HTl8h34j4L_ZNPpJVvcbwi0qGujc4naWXZvFfiOcQAWFqw6UF_enC1X7E7XYLSFTvZaI-21pI7ZGmoXNDrfDEJfozaKlts_6zZmN5XcQhggK6iNawjTFQzdsb8emlylNQJfPUEeEcY8BswaQjQY2paMgRyHmb13K03zB5L_rmIf2sY9_sPwrbPJj7ZbQi0MeKSy833nXQVYQkxaFL3XeWC9JiW6l0ukSlqy7JNmGoZW6fUmLfjay4KgKQwZykcnvQpjV8Luj5hNPxF8ZAtLR3o8OQR2vEIesTEwXhpWaGOyk2JeTAJ6t4PsZDab9fX0t1ZYZhf108BLcv_HOLDaE4v5-6QOEhyo51_eRe3z7FnzNwX5hFfgK6kVvb7ndESCU8sVCJ5RqaTfCS7sC-FkRPejsTnP0EeYcO_ituRZIU2gUayVRFhpSdeo6mdf_gIJ0FK_?type=png|width=1419,height=338!

Replay API REPL-37

[CS2 Server Infrastructure] Game Server Elastic-Scaling (GSES)

Tarefa Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 2:35 PM 29/out/24 11:21 AM 23/mai/24 2:35 PM           0 1   *Description:*

This task involves setting up an on-demand Counter-Strike 2 (CS2) server on Tencent Cloud that can be dynamically provisioned and deprovisioned based on player demand. The server should provide a seamless experience for players while ensuring optimal performance and cost efficiency.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* An on-demand CS2 server is successfully deployed on Tencent Cloud.
* The server can be automatically scaled up or down based on player demand.
* Players can join and leave the server seamlessly without experiencing lag or interruptions.
* The server performance is optimized for low latency and high frame rates.
* The server configuration is secure and protects against potential exploits or vulnerabilities.

*Technical Requirements:*

# *Tencent Cloud Resources:*
#* A Tencent Cloud account with sufficient resources (compute, storage, network) to host the CS2 server.
#* A suitable virtual machine (VM) instance type that meets the CS2 system requirements (e.g., CPU, RAM,GPU).
# *CS2 Server Software:*
#* The latest version of the CS2 Dedicated Server software from Valve.
#* Any additional plugins or modifications necessary for on-demand functionality.
# *Server Configuration:*
#* Configure the server for optimal performance (e.g., network settings, game settings).
#* Set up a secure connection (e.g., SSL/TLS) to protect player data.
#* Implement appropriate security measures (e.g., firewalls, intrusion detection) to prevent unauthorized access.
# *Scaling and Automation:*
#* Utilize Tencent Cloud's auto-scaling capabilities to dynamically adjust server resources based on player demand.
#* Set up monitoring and alerting to detect potential issues and trigger scaling actions.
# *Testing and Deployment:*
#* Thoroughly test the server under various conditions (e.g., different player counts, different maps).
#* Create a deployment plan that minimizes downtime and ensures a smooth transition for players.

*Implementation Steps:*

# *Create Tencent Cloud Resources:*
#* Create a VM instance with the appropriate specifications for the CS2 server.
#* Set up necessary networking (e.g., security groups, load balancers) for the server.
# *Install and Configure CS2 Server Software:*
#* Install the CS2 Dedicated Server software on the VM instance.
#* Configure the server settings according to the project requirements.
#* Install and configure any additional plugins or modifications as needed.
# *Set Up Scaling and Automation:*
#* Configure Tencent Cloud's auto-scaling policies to scale the server resources based on player demand.
#* Set up monitoring and alerting to detect potential issues.
# *Test and Deploy:*
#* Conduct thorough testing of the server under various conditions.
#* Implement the deployment plan to make the server available to players.

*Additional Considerations:*

* Consider using a containerization platform like Docker to streamline deployment and management of the CS2 server.
* Explore the use of Tencent Cloud's Game Server Elastic-Scaling (GSES) service, which is specifically designed for game server scaling.
* Regularly monitor the server performance and player feedback to identify areas for improvement.

*Labels:* CS2, Tencent Cloud, On-Demand, Server

----

*POC:*
*Docker Setup for On-Demand CS2 Server on Tencent Cloud*

This setup assumes basic familiarity with Docker and Tencent Cloud's container services (e.g., Tencent Kubernetes Engine - TKE).

# Docker Images:

* *CS2 Dedicated Server:* There isn't an official Docker image for the CS2 Dedicated Server yet. You will need to build your own image based on a suitable base image (e.g., Ubuntu) and install the CS2 server software within it.The installation process will likely involve downloading the server files from SteamCMD and configuring them appropriately.
* *Game Server Management (Optional):* Consider using a Docker image for game server management software like Agones (for Kubernetes) or Pterodactyl. These tools can help with scaling, monitoring, and managing your CS2 server instances.

# Dockerfile (for CS2 Dedicated Server Image):

{noformat}Dockerfile{noformat}

{noformat}# Use a suitable base image (e.g., Ubuntu)
FROM ubuntu:latest

# Install necessary dependencies (SteamCMD, screen, etc.)
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
steamcmd \
screen \
# ... other dependencies

# Set up the CS2 server user
RUN useradd -m cs2server

# Download and install the CS2 Dedicated Server (replace with your actual app ID)
USER cs2server
RUN steamcmd +login anonymous +force_install_dir /home/cs2server/server +app_update 740 validate +quit

# Expose the necessary ports
EXPOSE 27015/udp
EXPOSE 27015/tcp
# ... other ports if needed

# Set up a script to start the server
COPY start_server.sh /home/cs2server/
RUN chmod +x /home/cs2server/start_server.sh

# Start the server on container launch
CMD ["/home/cs2server/start_server.sh"]
{noformat}

# start_server.sh (Example):

{noformat}Bash{noformat}

{noformat}#!/bin/bash
# Replace with 1337gg params
screen -S cs2server -dmS cs2server ./srcds_run -game csgo -console -usercon +game_type 0 +game_mode 0 +mapgroup mg_active +map de_dust2
{noformat}

# Tencent Cloud Configuration:

* *Container Registry:* Push your custom CS2 server Docker image to a Tencent Cloud Container Registry (TCR) instance.
* *Kubernetes Cluster (If using TKE):*
** Create a Kubernetes cluster on TKE.
** Set up Agones (if using) for game server management.
** Deploy your CS2 server image as a StatefulSet or Deployment, depending on your scaling needs.
* *Scaling:* Configure auto-scaling rules based on metrics like CPU usage or player count. TKE offers Horizontal Pod Autoscaling (HPA) for this purpose.

*Additional Considerations:*

* *Storage:* If you need persistent storage for server data (e.g., demos, configuration files), set up a persistent volume claim (PVC) in Kubernetes or use Tencent Cloud's file storage services.
* *Networking:* Ensure proper network configuration for your container instances, including security groups and load balancing.
* *Monitoring and Logging:* Set up monitoring and logging to track server performance and player activity.

*Important Notes:*

* These are general guidelines. The specific implementation may vary depending on your exact requirements and preferences.
* The CS2 Dedicated Server software is still under development, so you may need to adjust your Docker image and configuration as the software evolves.
* Consult Tencent Cloud's documentation and support resources for assistance with specific configurations and deployments. 		23/mai/24 2:35 PM Em andamento CS:GO / CS:2
0|i0007z: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-36

[IaC][Prometheus][Grafana] Implement Prometheus-based Observability

Tarefa Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 1:31 PM   23/mai/24 1:31 PM           0 1   *Description:*

This ticket outlines the steps required to set up a comprehensive observability solution for your Go application deployed on Tencent Cloud using Prometheus, Grafana, and other relevant tools. The goal is to enable effective monitoring, alerting, and troubleshooting to ensure the application's performance, availability, and overall health.

*Scope:*

* Install and configure Prometheus on TKE (Tencent Kubernetes Engine)
* Instrument the Go application to expose metrics
* Configure Prometheus to scrape metrics from the application
* Deploy Grafana for visualization and dashboarding
* Create alerts based on key metrics and thresholds
* Integrate with Tencent Cloud logging services for centralized logging
* Implement best practices for secure and efficient observability

*Requirements:*

* *Prometheus:* Installed and configured on TKE.
* *Grafana:* Installed and configured to connect to Prometheus.
* *Prometheus Client Library (Go):* Integrated into the Go application.
* *Tencent Cloud Monitor:* (Optional) For integrating with Tencent Cloud's native monitoring services.
* *Tencent Cloud Logging (CLS):* (Optional) For centralized log collection and analysis.

*Security Requirements:*

* *Network Security:*
** Ensure that Prometheus and Grafana instances are protected by appropriate network security groups and firewalls.
** Limit access to Prometheus and Grafana endpoints to authorized users or systems.
* *Authentication and Authorization:*
** Enable authentication and authorization for Grafana dashboards.
** Use strong passwords or token-based authentication for Prometheus endpoints.
* *Data Security:*
** Encrypt sensitive metrics or data points if necessary.
** Implement retention policies for Prometheus data to manage storage costs.

*Step-by-Step Instructions:*

# *Install Prometheus on TKE:*
#* Use Helm or a similar tool to deploy Prometheus to your TKE cluster.
#* Configure Prometheus to discover your Go application pods and scrape metrics.
# *Instrument Go Application:*
#* Integrate the Prometheus client library for Go into your application.
#* Define custom metrics to track application-specific performance and behavior.
#* Expose a {{/metrics}} endpoint in your application for Prometheus to scrape.
# *Configure Prometheus:*
#* Create scrape configurations in Prometheus to collect metrics from your Go application.
#* Define recording rules for aggregating or transforming metrics if needed.
# *Deploy Grafana:*
#* Deploy Grafana on TKE or as a separate service.
#* Configure Grafana to connect to your Prometheus instance as a data source.
# *Create Dashboards and Alerts:*
#* Design Grafana dashboards to visualize key metrics and trends.
#* Set up alerts in Prometheus based on specific thresholds or conditions.
#* Integrate with notification channels (email, Slack, etc.) to receive alerts.
# *Integrate with Logging:*
#* If desired, forward application logs to Tencent Cloud Logging (CLS) for centralized log management and analysis.
# *Secure Observability Stack:*
#* Follow the security requirements outlined above to ensure the security of your observability tools and data.

*Additional Considerations:*

* *Metrics Selection:* Choose relevant metrics that align with your application's performance and business goals.
* *Alerting Strategy:* Define meaningful alerting rules to proactively detect and respond to issues.
* *Scalability:* Ensure your Prometheus and Grafana setups can scale to handle the increasing volume of metrics as your application grows.
* *Documentation:* Document the configuration and setup process for future reference and troubleshooting.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Prometheus is successfully deployed and configured on TKE.
* The Go application exposes relevant metrics for Prometheus to scrape.
* Grafana is installed and connected to Prometheus.
* Dashboards are created to visualize key metrics.
* Alerts are configured for critical thresholds.
* (Optional) Logs are integrated with Tencent Cloud Logging (CLS).
* All security requirements are met.

*Estimated Effort:* 24 hours 		23/mai/24 1:31 PM Em andamento EPIC: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and CI/CD Pipeline Implementation
0|i0007r: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-35

[IaC][Kubernetes] Set up Development Environment using TKE (TencentCloud's Kubernetes)

Tarefa Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 1:28 PM   23/mai/24 1:28 PM           0 1   *Description:*

This ticket outlines the steps required to create a secure and efficient Go development environment on Tencent Cloud, leveraging TKE (Tencent Kubernetes Engine) and other services. By following these instructions, developers will be able to seamlessly build, test, and deploy Go applications within the Tencent Cloud ecosystem.

*Scope:*

* Provision a TKE cluster
* Set up a container registry (TCR) for storing Go application images
* Establish a secure connection between the local development environment and TKE
* Configure a CI/CD pipeline for automated builds and deployments
* Integrate Tencent Cloud monitoring and logging services for observability
* Implement security best practices to protect applications and data

*Requirements:*

* *Tencent Cloud Account:* A valid Tencent Cloud account with necessary permissions.
* *Terraform:* Installed on the local machine for infrastructure provisioning.
* *Tencent Cloud CLI:* Installed and configured to interact with Tencent Cloud resources.
* *Docker:* Installed on the local machine for containerization.
* *kubectl:* Installed on the local machine to interact with the TKE cluster.
* *Go:* Installed on the local machine for development.
* *Git:* Installed on the local machine for version control.

*Security Requirements:*

* *Network Security:*
** Isolate TKE cluster within a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) with appropriate security groups.
** Restrict access to the Kubernetes API server to authorized IPs or VPN connections.
** Enable network policies to control traffic between pods.
* *Authentication and Authorization:*
** Use strong passwords or SSH keys for authentication.
** Implement role-based access control (RBAC) within TKE to manage user permissions.
** Consider using identity providers (e.g., Tencent Cloud CAM) for authentication.
* *Data Security:*
** Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit.
** Implement secure backup and disaster recovery strategies.
** Regularly audit access logs and monitor for suspicious activity.
* *Container Security:*
** Scan container images for vulnerabilities before deployment.
** Use minimal base images to reduce the attack surface.
** Apply least privilege principles to container permissions.

*Step-by-Step Instructions:*

# *Provision TKE Cluster:*
#* Use Terraform to define and create a TKE cluster within your Tencent Cloud account.
#* Specify the desired Kubernetes version, node types, and other configurations.
#* Securely store the {{kubeconfig}} file for cluster access.
# *Set up TCR:*
#* Create a container registry (TCR) instance in Tencent Cloud.
#* Configure authentication credentials (username/password or access tokens) for pushing and pulling images.
# *Connect to TKE:*
#* Install and configure {{kubectl}} to interact with the TKE cluster.
#* Use {{kubectl}} to test connectivity and deploy sample applications.
# *Configure CI/CD:*
#* Set up a CI/CD pipeline (e.g., using Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI) to automate the build, test, and deployment process.
#* Configure the pipeline to trigger on code changes and automatically deploy the latest container images to TCR.
# *Integrate Monitoring and Logging:*
#* Install and configure Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring TKE cluster metrics and application performance.
#* Integrate logging services (e.g., Tencent Cloud CLS) to collect and analyze application logs.
# *Implement Security Best Practices:*
#* Follow the security requirements outlined above to ensure a secure development environment.
#* Regularly review and update security configurations as needed.

*Additional Considerations:*

* *Cost Optimization:* Monitor resource usage and optimize your TKE cluster configuration to minimize costs.
* *Scalability:* Design your application and infrastructure to scale horizontally as needed.
* *Documentation:* Maintain clear documentation for the development environment setup process, including troubleshooting guides and best practices.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* A TKE cluster is successfully provisioned on Tencent Cloud.
* A container registry (TCR) is created and configured.
* A secure connection between the local development environment and TKE is established.
* A CI/CD pipeline is implemented for automated builds and deployments.
* Tencent Cloud monitoring and logging services are integrated.
* All security requirements are met.

*Estimated Effort:* 16 hours 		23/mai/24 1:28 PM Em andamento EPIC: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and CI/CD Pipeline Implementation
0|i0007j: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-34

[ART][DESIGN] Design & Implement Leet Cards - Digital Collectibles

Tarefa Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 10:04 AM   23/mai/24 10:06 AM           0 1   *Type:* Design Task

*Description:*

Design and implement visually stunning and engaging Leet Cards, personalized digital collectibles for [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] users, that showcase player stats, achievements, and highlight moments. The goal is to create a compelling feature that encourages user interaction, collection, and trading, contributing to increased engagement and platform growth.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* *Visual Appeal:* Leet Cards are visually captivating, utilizing high-quality graphics, animations (where appropriate),and a cohesive design language that aligns with the [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] brand.
* *Informative:* Cards effectively convey relevant player information, including stats, achievements, and highlights from replays.
* *Personalized:* Each card is uniquely tailored to the player, reflecting their individual style, preferences, and accomplishments.
* *Collectible:* Cards are designed with rarity tiers and special effects (e.g., foils) to encourage collecting and trading.
* *User-Friendly:* The card creation, viewing, and management interfaces are intuitive and easy to use.
* *Mobile-Responsive:* Card designs are optimized for viewing and interaction on various screen sizes and devices.
* *Accessibility:* Design adheres to accessibility guidelines to ensure inclusivity for all users.

*Tasks:*

# *Card Template Design:*
#* Research and gather inspiration from successful digital collectible card designs (e.g., sports cards, trading card games).
#* Create multiple card template options for different rarity tiers (common, rare, epic, legendary).
#* Design visual elements for stats, achievements, highlight clips, and special effects (e.g., foils, animations).
#* Ensure clear hierarchy and readability of information on the card.
# *Personalization Options:*
#* Design customizable elements for player avatars, names, and other personal touches.
#* Consider options for user-uploaded images or avatars.
#* Allow for custom color schemes or themes that align with players' preferences.
# *Rarity System:*
#* Define clear criteria for rarity tiers based on achievements, stats, or other factors.
#* Design unique visual elements and effects for each rarity tier to visually differentiate them.
#* Consider implementing a "foil" system for ultra-rare cards with special visual enhancements.
# *User Interface (UI) Design:*
#* Design intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for:
#** Card creation and customization
#** Card collection management (viewing, sorting, filtering)
#** Card showcase profiles
#** Trading marketplace (if applicable)
# *Interaction Design:*
#* Consider how users will interact with the cards (e.g., tapping to flip, zooming in on details).
#* Design animations or transitions to make the experience more engaging.

*Additional Considerations:*

* *Branding:* Ensure the card design aligns with the overall [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] brand identity and aesthetic.
* *Animation and Effects:* Explore using subtle animations and effects to enhance the visual appeal of the cards (without compromising performance).
* *Gamification:* Think about how the card design can integrate with future gamification features (e.g., card-based mini-games, rewards).
* *Accessibility:* Prioritize accessibility by ensuring sufficient contrast between colors, using clear fonts, and providing alternative text for images.

*Deliverables:*

* High-fidelity mockups of card templates for each rarity tier.
* Interactive prototypes of card creation, collection, and showcase interfaces.
* Style guide outlining design elements, colors, fonts, and visual effects for Leet Cards.
* Accessibility guidelines for ensuring card designs are inclusive for all users. 		23/mai/24 10:04 AM Em andamento EPIC: (PREMIUM CONTENT) Leet Cards – Personalized Digital Collectibles
0|i0007b: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-33

EPIC: (PREMIUM CONTENT) Leet Cards – Personalized Digital Collectibles

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 10:02 AM   23/mai/24 10:02 AM           0 1   *Description:*

{quote}Revolutionize user engagement and gamify the [LeetGaming.PRO|http://LeetGaming.PRO] experience by introducing Leet Cards, personalized digital collectibles that showcase player stats, achievements, and highlight moments from their replays. Allow users to curate their own collections, trade with others, and potentially utilize cards in future features or mini-games.{quote}

*Goals:*

# *Card Creation and Customization:*
#* *Replay Selection:* Allow users to select a limited number of replays to generate their Leet Cards.
#* *Card Design:* Create visually appealing card templates with customizable elements like:
#** Player name and avatar
#** Game and map
#** Featured stats (e.g., K/D ratio, ADR, HSP)
#** Highlight clip or image from the replay
#** Special effects or animations for rare achievements (e.g., 1v5 clutch)
#* *Rarity Tiers:* Introduce rarity tiers (common, rare, epic, legendary) for cards, based on the significance of the achievements or stats displayed.
# *Foil Cards:*
#* *Rarity:* Make foil cards the rarest tier, reserved for exceptional achievements (e.g., tournament wins, record-breaking stats).
#* *Visual Effects:* Design eye-catching visual effects for foil cards to differentiate them from regular cards (e.g., holographic shimmer, animated backgrounds).
# *Card Collection and Showcase:*
#* *Personal Collection:* Allow users to build and manage their own Leet Card collection within the platform.
#* *Showcase Profiles:* Enable users to showcase their favorite or most valuable cards on their profiles.
#* *Social Sharing:* Integrate social sharing features so users can show off their collections to friends and the community.
# *Card Trading and Marketplace:*
#* *Peer-to-Peer Trading:* Implement a secure and user-friendly marketplace for users to trade Leet Cards with each other.
#* *Auction System:* Consider adding an auction feature for rare or sought-after cards.
#* *Community Economy:* Foster a thriving in-app economy around card trading and collecting.
# *Future Expansion and Gamification:*
#* *Mini-Games:* Explore the development of mini-games that utilize Leet Cards, such as:
#** Deck-building games where players compete using their card collections.
#** Fantasy esports leagues where cards represent players or teams.
#** Trivia games testing knowledge of esports and [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] stats.
#* *In-Game Rewards:* Allow users to earn Leet Cards or card packs as rewards for completing challenges, participating in tournaments, or achieving milestones.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* *Engaging Collection Experience:* Users enjoy creating, collecting, and showcasing their personalized Leet Cards.
* *Active Marketplace:* The card trading marketplace becomes a vibrant hub for user interaction and economic activity.
* *Increased User Retention:* The gamification elements of Leet Cards contribute to increased user engagement and retention on the platform.
* *Positive Brand Image:* [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] is perceived as innovative and community-oriented.

*Technical Considerations:*

* *Card Generation Engine:* Develop a robust system for generating personalized card images based on user data and achievements.
* *Blockchain Integration (Optional):* Consider using blockchain technology to create truly unique and verifiable digital collectibles (NFTs).
* *Marketplace Development:* Build a secure and scalable marketplace for card trading.
* *Game Development (Optional):* If mini-games are pursued, allocate resources for game design and development.

*Visual Representation DRAFT (Mermaid Diagram):*

EPIC: (PREMIUM CONTENT) Fan Engagement and Rewards with Leet Tokens (LGT)

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 23/mai/24 9:52 AM   23/mai/24 9:52 AM           0 1   *Description:*

{quote}Revolutionize fan engagement and monetization by introducing Leet Tokens (LGT), a platform-specific cryptocurrency that rewards fans for their attention and interaction with [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] content and events. LGT can be earned, traded, and redeemed for exclusive experiences and merchandise, fostering a thriving community and driving revenue growth.{quote}

*Goals:*

# *Leet Token (LGT) Design and Implementation:*
#* *Tokenomics:* Design a sustainable token economy with clear rules for earning, spending, and trading LGT.
#* *Blockchain Integration:* Choose a suitable blockchain platform (e.g., Ethereum, Solana, Polygon) or consider a private blockchain for greater control and lower transaction fees.
#* *Wallet Integration:* Enable users to connect their existing crypto wallets or create [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] wallets to store and manage their LGT.
# *Earning Mechanisms:*
#* *Watching Content:* Award LGT for watching live streams, VODs (video on demand), tutorials, and other content on the platform.
#* *Interacting with Content:* Award LGT for liking, commenting, sharing, and participating in discussions related to [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] content.
#* *Predicting Match Outcomes:* Create prediction markets where fans can use LGT to bet on the outcomes of esports matches.
#* *Participating in Community Events:* Offer LGT rewards for participating in quizzes, contests, polls, and other community events.
#* *Staking:* Allow users to stake their LGT to earn additional rewards or participate in governance decisions.
# *Redemption and Rewards:*
#* *Exclusive Experiences:*
#** Meet-and-greets with pro players.
#** Backstage passes to esports events.
#** Opportunities to play with or against their favorite teams in custom matches.
#** VIP access to online tournaments or viewing parties.
#* *Merchandise:*
#** [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] branded apparel, accessories, and collectibles.
#** In-game items or skins for supported esports titles.
#** Limited edition merchandise signed by pro players.
#* *Premium Content:*
#** Access to exclusive analysis, tutorials, and behind-the-scenes content.
#** Early access to new features or beta tests.
# *Marketplace and Trading:*
#* *Peer-to-Peer Trading:* Enable users to trade LGT with each other on a secure marketplace within the platform.
#* *External Exchange Integration:* Explore integrating with external cryptocurrency exchanges to allow for broader trading of LGT.
#* *Price Discovery:* Establish a transparent and fair mechanism for determining the value of LGT based on supply and demand.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* *Engaged Fans:* LGT incentivizes fans to spend more time on the platform and engage with content more actively.
* *Increased Revenue:* The LGT economy generates new revenue streams for [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] through token sales, marketplace fees, and premium content purchases.
* *Strong Community:* The LGT ecosystem fosters a sense of community and belonging among fans.
* *Positive Brand Image:* [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] is perceived as innovative and forward-thinking within the esports industry.

*Technical Considerations:*

* *Smart Contract Development:* Develop secure and auditable smart contracts to manage the LGT token, its distribution, and interactions with the platform.
* *Wallet Integration:* Integrate with popular crypto wallets (e.g., MetaMask) and potentially develop a custom wallet for [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO].
* *Security:* Prioritize security measures to protect user wallets and LGT holdings from unauthorized access or theft.
* *Legal and Regulatory Compliance:* Ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations regarding cryptocurrency and token offerings.



*DRAFT*:

Replay API REPL-31

EPIC: Enhanced Transparency and Reliability with Comprehensive Status and Performance Insights

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 21/mai/24 3:50 PM   21/mai/24 3:50 PM           0 1   Absolutely! Here's a Jira EPIC tailored to creating an outstanding Service Status page and Test/Pipeline Data dashboard for [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO], with features that would showcase a high level of technical sophistication:

*Description:*

{quote}Develop a state-of-the-art service status page and a detailed pipeline/test data dashboard to provide real-time visibility into system health, performance, and development progress, fostering trust and confidence in the platform's reliability and engineering excellence.{quote}

*Goals:*

# *Service Status Page:*
#* *Real-time Status Monitoring:* Display the current status of all core services and components (API, database, frontend, third-party integrations) with clear indicators (operational, degraded, outage).
#* *Incident Communication:* Provide timely and transparent updates on ongoing incidents, including root cause analysis, estimated time to resolution (ETR), and mitigation steps.
#* *Historical Data:* Display historical uptime and incident data for transparency and trend analysis.
#* *Performance Metrics:* Showcase key performance metrics like response times, error rates, and uptime percentages.
#* *Subscribe to Updates:* Allow users to subscribe to status updates via email, SMS, or webhook notifications.
#* *Customizable Views:* Enable users to customize the information they see based on their interests and needs.
# *Test and Pipeline Data Dashboard:*
#* *Pipeline Visibility:* Visualize the status and progress of CI/CD pipelines (build, test, deploy) for all projects and environments.
#* *Test Results:* Display comprehensive test results, including success rates, failure rates, and code coverage for unit, integration, and end-to-end tests.
#* *Performance Testing:* Showcase performance test results, including load testing, stress testing, and response time analysis under various conditions.
#* *Code Quality Metrics:* Track code quality metrics like code complexity, code smells, and technical debt.
#* *Deployment History:* Maintain a detailed history of deployments, including release notes, changes, and rollback capabilities.
# *Integration and Automation:*
#* *Integrate with Monitoring Tools:* Seamlessly integrate the service status page and dashboard with existing monitoring and observability tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, New Relic).
#* *Automated Incident Detection:* Utilize machine learning or anomaly detection algorithms to proactively identify potential issues before they escalate.
#* *Automated Reporting:* Generate regular reports on system health, performance trends, and testing results.
#* *API for External Integration:* Provide a public API to allow third-party integrations and custom dashboards.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* *Real-time Transparency:* The service status page accurately reflects the current state of the platform in real time.
* *Comprehensive Data:* The dashboard provides detailed insights into test results, pipeline status, and code quality.
* *Actionable Insights:* Data is presented in a clear and actionable way, empowering teams to quickly identify and address issues.
* *Proactive Monitoring:* Potential problems are detected and addressed before they impact users.
* *Reliability and Trust:* The transparency and reliability of the platform instill confidence in users and potential partners.

*Technical Considerations:*

* *Status Page Framework:* Consider using open-source status page frameworks (e.g., Cachet, Statusfy, Staytus) or build a custom solution.
* *Data Visualization:* Utilize libraries like D3.js, Chart.js, or Grafana to create interactive and informative visualizations.
* *Monitoring Tools:* Choose appropriate monitoring and observability tools based on your tech stack and requirements.
* *API Design:* Design a well-documented and easy-to-use API for external integrations.
* *Security:* Implement security measures to protect sensitive data and prevent unauthorized access to the status page and dashboard.

*Visual Representation (Mermaid Diagram):*

!https://mermaid.ink/img/pako:eNpVj81OwzAQhF9l5QOnFu45VErjCiGBGjWcsDls421iEduRf5Cqqu-OTQqI2zczu6PdC-udIlaxweM8wvNBWoCQjjdJFB89Gm2H-_awLxlALTryn7qn8L4YW9E8PTQcWj3TpO2v34hXCnFRZNW_5hdndXQ-F8Md1Banc9BhWeOiixhTgBYHulXtBMcwHh169VdXoIb1egO84PYbdwWbBdmKGfIGtcoPXkogWRzJkGRVRoX-QzJpr3kOU3Td2fasij7RiqVZYSSuMZ9rfswZ7ZtzWZ5wCnT9Aik0ZfU?type=png|width=391,height=288!

Replay API REPL-30

EPIC: Project Management - Jira Setup

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 21/mai/24 2:49 PM   21/mai/24 3:18 PM           0 1   Project Structure:

* *One Project vs. Multiple Projects:* Consider starting with a single Jira project encompassing all epics. This simplifies initial setup and allows for easier cross-team collaboration. As the project grows and teams become more specialized, you can later split it into smaller, focused projects (e.g., "Replay API," "Frontend," "Data Science").
* *Epics:* Your existing epics provide a good high-level breakdown of the project's major components.
* *Components:* Utilize components within the project to categorize issues further (e.g., "Authentication," "Dashboard," "Data Analysis").
* *Labels:* Use labels to categorize issues by theme, priority, or other relevant attributes.

# Issue Types:

* *Epic:* For the high-level objectives you've already defined.
* *Story:* For user-centric features and functionality.
* *Task:* For smaller, technical tasks that don't directly deliver user value.
* *Bug:* For tracking and resolving defects.
* *Improvement:* For enhancements or optimizations to existing features.

# Workflows:

* *Customize Workflows:* Tailor your workflows to match your development process. Consider a basic workflow with statuses like "To Do," "In Progress," "Code Review," "QA," and "Done."
* *Automation:* Utilize Jira automation to streamline tasks like transitioning issues between statuses, assigning tasks, and sending notifications.

# Boards:

* *Kanban Board:* Use a Kanban board for visualizing the flow of work and managing WIP (Work in Progress) limits.
* *Scrum Board:* If you're following Scrum, use a Scrum board to track sprints, estimate effort, and manage backlog refinement.
* *Dashboards:* Create dashboards to visualize key metrics (e.g., sprint progress, team velocity, open issues) and track progress towards goals.

# Additional Tips:

* *Prioritize:* Rank epics and stories based on business value and dependencies.
* *Estimate Effort:* Assign story points or time estimates to issues to help with planning and forecasting.
* *Regular Refinement:* Refine your backlog regularly to ensure it stays up-to-date and relevant.
* *Continuous Feedback:* Encourage frequent communication and feedback within the team to identify and address blockers.
* *Integrations:* Integrate Jira with other tools like Bitbucket, GitHub, or Slack to enhance collaboration and visibility.

*Specific Recommendations for* [*LeetGraming.PRO*|http://LeetGraming.PRO]*:*

* *Custom Fields:* Consider adding custom fields to track specific metrics relevant to your project (e.g., "Game Title," "Demo Type," "Analysis Metric").
* *Test Management:* Integrate Jira with a test management tool (e.g., Xray, Zephyr) to track test cases and results.
* *Security Considerations:* Configure permissions and access controls carefully to protect sensitive data.

*DRAFT Jira Project Setup:*

* *Project Name:* [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] Development
* *Key:* LGP (or a similar abbreviation)
* *Issue Types:* Epic, Story, Task, Bug, Improvement
* *Components:* Authentication, Demo Parsing, Data Modeling, API Endpoints, Analysis Engine, UI/UX, Frontend,Backend, etc.
* *Labels:* Priority (High, Medium, Low), Status (To Do, In Progress, etc.), Game (CS:GO, Valorant, etc.), Feature Area (Dashboard, Analysis, etc.) 		21/mai/24 2:49 PM Em andamento purple
0|i0006f: Nenhum
Replay API REPL-29

EPIC: AI-Powered Virtual Coach (codenamed "ReplayAI")

Epic Discovery & Refinement Medium Não resolvido(s) Não atribuído Leet Gaming Leet Gaming 21/mai/24 2:44 PM   28/mai/24 1:29 PM           0 1   (!) *Confidentiality and Feasibility Statement*

{quote}The information contained within this document is considered confidential and proprietary to [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO]. It is intended for internal review and discussion purposes only and should not be shared with external parties without express written consent.

The concepts, features, and technologies outlined herein are subject to ongoing evaluation and feasibility analysis. While [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] is committed to innovation and pushing the boundaries of esports analytics, it is understood that not all ideas may be technically feasible, financially viable, or fully compliant with existing legal frameworks or third-party licenses.

[LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] reserves the right to modify, alter, or abandon any of the proposed concepts without notice. Any implementation decisions will be made after careful consideration of technical feasibility, legal compliance, user demand, and strategic alignment with the company's overall goals and vision.


*By accessing and reviewing this document, you acknowledge the confidential nature of its contents and agree not to disclose any information contained herein to unauthorized parties.*{quote}

----

h1. 🏆 EPIC: AI-Powered Virtual Coach (codenamed "Project Athena")


*Description:*

{quote}Develop an AI-powered virtual coach that leverages the vast knowledge base of [LeetGraming.PRO|http://LeetGraming.PRO] to provide real-time, personalized guidance and analysis to players during live gameplay, transforming the way esports athletes train and compete.{quote}

*Goals:*

# *Real-Time Voice and Text Analysis:*
#* *Voice Recognition:* Utilize state-of-the-art speech-to-text technology to transcribe in-game communication (voice chat) in real-time.
#* *Textual Analysis:* Analyze chat logs, identifying key callouts, strategic discussions, emotional cues, and potential communication issues.
#* *Natural Language Processing (NLP):* Employ NLP to understand the context of communication and derive meaningful insights about team coordination, strategy, and decision-making.
# *In-Game Overlay and Insights:*
#* *Real-time Feedback:* Provide real-time feedback to players through an unobtrusive in-game overlay ,highlighting areas for improvement (e.g., positioning, crosshair placement, economy management) based on the analysis of their actions and communication.
#* *Strategic Suggestions:* Offer dynamic suggestions for strategies and tactics based on the current game state ,opponent tendencies, and team composition.
#* *Performance Comparison:* Display real-time comparisons of player performance against their own averages, teammates, and professional players.
#* *Customizable Interface:* Allow users to customize the overlay to display the information they find most valuable.
# *Post-Game Analysis and Review:*
#* *AI-Generated Highlights:* Automatically generate highlight reels of key moments in a match, focusing on critical decisions, impactful plays, and areas for improvement.
#* *Detailed Performance Reports:* Provide in-depth reports that combine data from the in-game analysis with post-match demo review for a comprehensive understanding of individual and team performance.
#* *Personalized Training Plans:* Generate tailored training plans based on the identified weaknesses and areas for improvement.
#* *Virtual Coaching Sessions:* Offer the option for virtual coaching sessions with the AI coach to discuss specific scenarios and strategies.
# *Machine Learning and Continuous Improvement:*
#* *Reinforcement Learning:* Implement reinforcement learning algorithms to continuously improve the AI coach's decision-making and recommendations based on player feedback and outcomes.
#* *Data-Driven Evolution:* Gather data from thousands of matches to refine the AI's understanding of optimal playstyles, strategies, and meta trends.
#* *Adaptive Learning:* Tailor the AI coach's approach to individual players, adapting to their skill levels, preferences, and learning styles.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* *Enhanced Performance:* Players using the AI coach demonstrate measurable improvement in their gameplay and decision-making skills.
* *Positive User Experience:* The in-game overlay is user-friendly, unobtrusive, and provides valuable real-time insights.
* *Personalized Guidance:* The AI coach's feedback and recommendations are tailored to individual players and their specific needs.
* *Continuous Improvement:* The AI coach's capabilities evolve and improve over time, adapting to the ever-changing esports landscape.

*Technical Considerations:*

* *Advanced AI Technologies:* Utilize cutting-edge AI technologies like natural language processing (NLP),computer vision, and reinforcement learning.
* *Data Pipeline:* Build a robust data pipeline to collect, process, and analyze large volumes of in-game data in real-time.
* *Game Integration:* Develop integrations with popular esports titles to seamlessly integrate the AI coach's overlay and features.
* *Privacy and Security:* Ensure the privacy and security of user data and comply with relevant regulations.

*Visual Representation DRAFT (Mermaid Diagram):*

!https://mermaid.ink/img/pako:eNqNkUFvwjAMhf9K5DPd7j1MYmNCkzZRlYkDCQev8WhE41RJiqgQ_30h27iAtN387O9ZevYRGqcJSth67FvxWisOw8ePIIpzj9bw9q6qF4qFmMqasCuisSRWzjR0_06HKKaM3RhM2IiieBCP8oWLOSZksSff4bj5t_VJVi7Eb_NlcnZf78z8TFapJp-Zm-Zr7CLy6Fm-YdMaphQXPaesGbrRzvhfKRQTa5iAJW_R6HTY43mdgtiSJQVlKjX6nQLFp8ThEN1y5AbK6AeawNBrjDQzmF5gofzELqRuj7x27lefvgCZIJRN?type=png|width=409,height=436!

[https://mermaid.live/edit#pako:eNqNkUFvwjAMhf9K5DPd7j1MYmNCkzZRlYkDCQev8WhE41RJiqgQ_30h27iAtN387O9ZevYRGqcJSth67FvxWisOw8ePIIpzj9bw9q6qF4qFmMqasCuisSRWzjR0_06HKKaM3RhM2IiieBCP8oWLOSZksSff4bj5t_VJVi7Eb_NlcnZf78z8TFapJp-Zm-Zr7CLy6Fm-YdMaphQXPaesGbrRzvhfKRQTa5iAJW_R6HTY43mdgtiSJQVlKjX6nQLFp8ThEN1y5AbK6AeawNBrjDQzmF5gofzELqRuj7x27lefvgCZIJRN)|https://mermaid.live/edit#pako:eNqNkUFvwjAMhf9K5DPd7j1MYmNCkzZRlYkDCQev8WhE41RJiqgQ_30h27iAtN387O9ZevYRGqcJSth67FvxWisOw8ePIIpzj9bw9q6qF4qFmMqasCuisSRWzjR0_06HKKaM3RhM2IiieBCP8oWLOSZksSff4bj5t_VJVi7Eb_NlcnZf78z8TFapJp-Zm-Zr7CLy6Fm-YdMaphQXPaesGbrRzvhfKRQTa5iAJW_R6HTY43mdgtiSJQVlKjX6nQLFp8ThEN1y5AbK6AeawNBrjDQzmF5gofzELqRuj7x27lefvgCZIJRN)|smart-link]

A[Real-time Voice/Text Analysis] --> C[Post-Game Analysis]
B[In-Game Overlay] --> D[Player]
C[Post-Game Analysis] --> D[Player]
D[Player] --> E[Machine Learning]
E[Machine Learning] --> A[Real-time Voice/Text Analysis]
